memory.title: Birth
memory.memory: I was born on a warm spring day. My parents named me Kamiya Tooru. I was their first child and they were overjoyed.

memory.title: Learning Photography
memory.memory: My father taught me how to use a camera for the first time. I was fascinated by how I could capture moments forever.

memory.title: First Day of School
memory.memory: My first day at elementary school. I was nervous but excited to meet new friends and learn new things.

memory.title: Photography Award
memory.memory: I received an award for my photography project. My parents were so proud and encouraged me to pursue my passion.

memory.title: Photography Friend
memory.memory: I made my first best friend at the park. We shared a love for photography and spent hours taking pictures together.

memory.title: Middle School Graduation
memory.memory: I graduated from middle school. It was bittersweet saying goodbye to friends, but I was excited for high school.

memory.title: High School Begins
memory.memory: My first day as a high school student. Everything felt bigger and more serious. I was excited to start this new journey.

memory.title: Parents Leaving for Europe
memory.memory: My parents left for a long trip today. They're going to Europe for several weeks. I'm a bit nervous about living alone, but they trust me to take care of the house.

memory.title: Getting Used to Living Alone
memory.memory: I'm getting used to living alone. I have to cook, clean, and manage everything myself. It's challenging but also gives me more freedom.

memory.title: Meeting Hino for the First Time
memory.memory: I first met Hino Maori in the school library. She was reading a book and looked so focused and beautiful. I felt an immediate connection and decided to approach her.

memory.title: Joining Literature Club for Hino
memory.memory: I joined the literature club to spend more time with Hino. She was passionate about books and writing. I fell in love with her enthusiasm and wanted to get to know her better.

memory.title: Discovering Hino's Memory Condition
memory.memory: After the literature club meeting, I overheard a teacher talking about Hino's condition. She loses her memories every day when she sleeps. I was shocked and heartbroken, but I knew I had to help her.

memory.title: Researching Memory Conditions
memory.memory: I spent hours researching memory conditions and how to help someone with daily amnesia. I wanted to understand how to support Hino better and find ways to help her remember.

memory.title: Planning to Help Hino
memory.memory: I'm planning how to help Hino today. Since she won't remember me from yesterday, I need to be gentle and patient. I'll use my photography to document our time together and help her remember.
